description: From Late Latin ōidium, from Ancient Greek ᾠόν (ōión, “egg”)  +‎ -ium.

entries.meaning: A fragile spore produced by some fungi.
examples: • Oidia are hyaline, small and thin-walled unicellular sections or fragments of the mycelium.
• Oidia may be uni- or binucleate as whether they are produced by the breaking up of the primary or secondary mycelium.

entries.meaning: The fungus Erysiphe necator (= Uncinula necator), which produces powdery mildew in grapes.
